intro: Pultenaea mutabilis, commonly known as the variable pultenaea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its variable leaf shape and color. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that appear in spring, followed by elongated, woody pods. It thrives in sandy or loamy soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens across Australia.
